column3: China were reported to be suffering from unknown viral pneumonia. Soon after
column4: more patients in that city were diagnosed with the same disease. On January 9
column5: scientists identified a new virus as the cause of the mysterious disease. They found that the new virus belongs to a class of viruses called coronavirus
column6: and so they named it SARS-CoV-2. The name comes from the disease it causes: severe acute respiratory syndrome; CoV stands for coronavirus
column7: and the number 2 was added because it is the second coronavirus that causes a serious respiratory disease.Next
column8: scientists examined the DNA of the virus they recovered from a sick person and the results were surprising. They discovered that the new virus infecting humans is very similar to a coronavirus found in bats (96% similarity). This outcome led them to think that the virus must have jumped from bats to humans. But did SARS-CoV-2 jump directly from bats to humans? Or did it first infect an intermediate animal before it got to humans? So far
column10: but scientists seem to agree that SARS-CoV-2 jumped from an animal to humans.
